item.title: 20 Romantic Things To Do In Wine Country This Valentine's Day
item.description:
20 Romantic Things To Do In Wine Country This Valentine's Day

There will be plenty of love in the Wine Country air this Valentine's Day as couples celebrate not just the most romantic day of the year but a three-day weekend thanks to President's Day. We've rounded up 20 romantic things to do in Wine Country-10 in the Napa Valley and 10 in Sonoma County-so you can get started on your Feb.

item.title: Celebrate the 40th Anniversary of Napa Valley's Triumph over French Wines
item.description:
Celebrate the 40th Anniversary of Napa Valley's Triumph over French Wines

Auberge du Soleil is offering a five-course meal and special wine pairings in honor of the historic occasion...

item.title: Ask Well: Health Benefits of Red Wine vs. Grape Juice
item.description:
Ask Well: Health Benefits of Red Wine vs. Grape Juice

A Red wine is probably better for you than grape juice because the fermentation process involved in making wine changes the makeup of the juice, and the skin of the grape, which is loaded with healthful antioxidants, is more likely to be used in the winemaking process, said Dr. Antonia Trichopoulou, a professor and director of the World Health Organization Collaborating Center for Nutrition at the University of Athens School of Medicine in Greece.

item.title: Tasting notes: The wines of Amber Knolls
item.description:
Tasting notes: The wines of Amber Knolls

Amber Knolls fruit has mostly been used as a blending component in wines that carry the North Coast or California appellation, according to Andy Beckstoffer. [...] what sorts of wines does Amber Knolls produce?

item.title: Beckstoffer's next quest - transform Lake County into wine country
item.description:
Beckstoffer's next quest - transform Lake County into wine country

Grapegrower Andy Beckstoffer is famous for helping transform grape-growing in Napa Valley into a highly lucrative, luxury-branded business, able to fetch some of the highest-priced cabernet sauvignon grapes in the world. Now he intends to expand his branding prowess to his vineyards in the Red Hills appellation of Lake County.

item.title: Quirky Verseur 4-in1 Wine Opener
item.description:
Quirky Verseur 4-in1 Wine Opener

Quirky Verseur 4-in1 Wine Opener In theory, corkscrews are great tools. In practice, however, they're often either challenging to use, over-engineered, or prohibitively expensive. But as I opened a bottle of wine on New Year's Eve, I realized that the Quirky Verseur is by far the easiest, fastest corkscrew I've ever used.

item.title: Wine Market Council Defines the Industry's Latest Trends | Wine Enthusiast Magazine
item.description:
Wine Market Council Defines the Industry's Latest Trends | Wine Enthusiast Magazine

On Monday, January 25, 2016, the Wine Market Council-a non-profit association of wine producers, importers and other industry experts-together with the Nielsen Company, gathered at the Modern Museum of Art in New York City to present their findings on U.S. consumer wine trends.

item.title: Asian-style Meatballs in Lettuce Wraps | Wine Enthusiast Magazine
item.description:
Asian-style Meatballs in Lettuce Wraps | Wine Enthusiast Magazine

Serve this pan-Asian dish with steamed rice or with a warm piece of naan, a leavened flatbread of India. As for what to drink, go with a brew. A malty Tsingtao from China, a chilled Kirin from Japan or a citrus-scented Singha from India would all make for a winning pairing.

item.title: The California Rosés You Need to Stock Up On Now | Wine Enthusiast Magazine
item.description:
The California Rosés You Need to Stock Up On Now | Wine Enthusiast Magazine

By all accounts, the 2015 vintage in Northern California was exceptional, but what it wasn't? Abundant. It produced nowhere near what 2012 and 2013 did. And 2014 was a triple streak of quality and quantity in California wine. The good news? We still have plenty of great wine to look forward to.
